results.title: Metformin Attenuates Hypoxia-induced Endothelial Cell Injury by Activating the AMP-Activated Protein Kinase Pathway.
results.text_hl: Here, we investigated the role of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ in @DISEASE_Corneal_Endothelial_Cell_Loss @DISEASE_MESH:D055954 @@@endothelial cell injury@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Fuchs</m>'<m>_Endothelial_Dystrophy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005642 @@@endothelial@@@-mesenchymal transition (EndMT) induced by @DISEASE_Hypoxia @DISEASE_MESH:D000860 @@@hypoxia@@@.

citations.NLM: Hu J, Zheng Z, Li X, Li B, Lai X, Li N, Lei S. Metformin Attenuates Hypoxia-induced Endothelial Cell Injury by Activating the AMP-Activated Protein Kinase Pathway. J Cardiovasc Pharmacol. 2021 Jun 1;77(6):862-874. PMID: 33929389

results.title: Nanoparticle-Reinforced Tough Hydrogel as a Versatile Platform for Pharmaceutical Drug Delivery: Preparation and in Vitro Characterization.
results.text_hl: Cryogel-loaded @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ reduced the effect of @<m>DISEASE_Fuchs</m>'<m>_Endothelial_Dystrophy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005642 @@@endothelial@@@ cell injury caused by nutrient deprivation in vitro.

citations.NLM: Chakraborty A, Pacelli S, Alexander S, Huayamares S, Rosenkrans Z, Vergel FE, Wu Y, Chakravorty A, Paul A. Nanoparticle-Reinforced Tough Hydrogel as a Versatile Platform for Pharmaceutical Drug Delivery: Preparation and in Vitro Characterization. Mol Pharm. 2023 Jan 2;20(1):767-774. PMID: 36322617

results.title: [INFLUENCE OF THE METFORMIN THERAPY ON THE ACTIVITY OF ENDOTHELIAL-DEPENDENT MEDIATORS AMONG PATIENTS WITH ACUTE MYOCARDIAL INFARCTION AND CONCOMITANT TYPE 2 DIABETES MELLITUS].
results.text_hl: [INFLUENCE OF THE @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@METFORMIN@@@ THERAPY ON THE ACTIVITY OF @<m>DISEASE_Fuchs</m>'<m>_Endothelial_Dystrophy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005642 @@@ENDOTHELIAL@@@-DEPENDENT MEDIATORS AMONG PATIENTS WITH @DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@ACUTE MYOCARDIAL INFARCTION@@@ AND CONCOMITANT @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Noninsulin_Dependent_2 @DISEASE_MESH:C563323 @@@TYPE 2 DIABETES MELLITUS@@@].

results.title: Prevention of type 2 diabetes: role of metformin.
results.text_hl: In addition, it has demonstrated favourable action on several cardiovascular risk factors that are often present in these individuals: it favours the maintenance of diet-induced @DISEASE_Weight_Loss @DISEASE_MESH:D015431 @@@weight loss@@@ and its associated improvement in fibrinolysis; and it lowers plasma concentrations of fasting @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@, total and low density lipoprotein-cholesterol, @CHEMICAL_Fatty_Acids_Nonesterified @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005230 @@@free fatty acids@@@, and of two markers of @<m>DISEASE_Fuchs</m>'<m>_Endothelial_Dystrophy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005642 @@@endothelial@@@ damage--tissue plasminogen activator antigen and @GENE_VWF @GENE_7450 @@@von Willebrand factor@@@.

citations.NLM: Charles MA, Eschwège E. Prevention of type 2 diabetes: role of metformin. Drugs. 1999;58 Suppl 1():71-3; discussion 75-82. PMID: 10576529
citations.BibTeX: @article{10576529, title={Prevention of type 2 diabetes: role of metformin.}, author={Charles MA and Eschwège E}, journal={Drugs}, volume={58 Suppl 1}, pages={71-3; discussion 75-82}}
